properties.verseOrder: v1 c1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Oh my name is McShane from the plains of Kildare Farmer I was, until the last year Till I got a notion out by the promotion Went over to England to harvest my share

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Rum turalee, rum tur-a-lalley Rum turalee, misha tur-a-lie-ay

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: I parted with Molly so blithe and so jolly I picked up a stick for a staff in me hand To keep myself cheery, for fear I'll grow weary I sang as I walked as I marched through the land

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: I landed in England on a bright summers evening The lap of the kiltar I held in me hand Some of them laughing, and some of them chanting And some of them trying to put Paddy away

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: I went to this woman, and I asked her for lodging She instantly showed me the bed in the room And being so tired and so worn out from walking I layed myself down on the bed in the room

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Old Lumpar the Tinker stood up from the corner He said "By my soul I will cut off your life" Says I "Old Tinker, you know who you're daggin' For I'm old McShane from the plains of Kildare"

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: He tried for to fetch me a punch in the stomach I instantly nailed him a one in the throat He went like a heel over head in the corner and cut his old head on a rusty old cot

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: He lay on the floor, like a sheep he was bleeding I swore by my soul I would cut off his life I lifted him up and sat down for a naggin' and me and old Tinker we ended our strife

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: Well my name is McShane from the plains of Kildare Farmer I was until the last year Till I got a notion out by the promotion Went over to England to harvest my share
